document.masterDocTitle: Bees of the genus Anthidium Fabricius, 1804 (Hymenoptera: Apoidea: Megachilidae: Anthidiini) from China

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 25.
Anthidium ( Anthidium ) septemspinosum Lepeletier, 1841
. Female. a: Body in lateral view; b: Head in frontal view; c: Clypeus in frontal view; d: Mesosoma in dorsal view; e: Metasoma in dorsal view; f: T4–T6 in dorsal view. Scale bars: 1 mm.

Distribution: China ( Beijing , Hebei , Shanxi , Inner Mongolia , Heilongjiang , Jilin , Shaanxi , Henan , Shandong , Hunan , Jiangsu , Shanghai , Zhejiang , Anhui , Jiangxi , Guangxi , Qinghai , Xinjiang , Fujian , Sichuan , Yunnan ); Spain , France , Germany , Austria , Switzerland , Italy , Czechia , Hungary , Slovenia , Croatia , Romania , Bulgaria , Greece , Belarus , Ukraine , Turkey , Siberia, Afghanistan , Kazakhstan , Mongolia , Japan , South Korea , Russia (European part, Urals, Siberia, Far East).

( Lamiaceae ),

( Asteraceae ),

,
Melilotus officinalis
( Fabaceae ),
Lythrum salicaria
( Lythraceae ) ( Banaszak & Romasenko, 1998 ; Wu, 2006 ).
